name: Definitions
text:
As used in this [chapter], unless the context clearly requires otherwise:
     "Grant" means an award of state funds by the legislature, by an appropriation to a specified recipient, to support the activities of the recipient and permit the community to benefit from those activities.
     "Recipient" means any organization or person receiving a grant or subsidy.
     "Subsidy" means an award of state funds by the legislature, by an appropriation to a recipient specified in the appropriation, to reduce the costs incurred by the organization or individual in providing a service available to some or all members of the public. [L 1997, c 190, pt of §3]
